name: snowscape
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an area of land covered in snow, or a work of art that represents this: Many scientific teams are scattered over the frigid Greenland snowscape taking samples. You enter the gallery to be confronted by a vast snowscape depicting a post-apocalyptic London.
More examplesFewer examplesThere was so much spray and foam in the air that all of the bay looked like a snowscape.The setting sun cast a reddish glow over the wind-blown snowscape. Heading through the Norwegian snowscape, you might glimpse a state-run train ploughing on; it will be on time whatever the weather.At the auction, I watched as a tiny Aivazovsky snowscape sold for five times its estimate.
